intro: Borreria australiana, commonly known as the Australian borreria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in coastal regions. Borreria australiana is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to grow in poor soil conditions.
